AttackerCapabilities: Understanding of prototype pollution and off-by-one error
Ability to analyze JavaScript code for vulnerabilities
Knowledge of HTTP requests and responses

Vulnerabilities: Off-by-one error in background.js font validation

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to exploit the prototype pollution vulnerability in the utils.merge() function.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a payload to pollute the utils.FONTS array and bypass the validation in the for loop.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully pollutes the utils.FONTS array, allowing them to use a malicious font.

Steps.Description: Leverage the off-by-one error in background.js font validation

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to exploit the off-by-one error in the font validation to bypass the validation and load an external font using the fetch() call.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker manipulates the fetch() call in setFont.js to use the credentials for http://app/ by polluting the credentials: include option.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully loads an external font and the output is placed in the exploit page's style element.
